wikipedia_page.main: Major Alfred Cecil Herring  (26 October 1888 – 10 August 1966) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Second Lieutenant Alfred Cecil Herring VC. Army Service Corps. 23 March 1918.

response: |Alfred Cecil Herring ||  British Army || 1918 || First World War || Montagne Bridge
* Maj Alfred Cecil Herring  (1888–1966), recipient of the Victoria CrossMax Arthur, Symbol of Courage: The Men Behind the Medal, p320, Pan Macmillan, 2005, , 9780330491334
*Alfred Cecil Herring (1888–1966), Royal Army Service Corps officer

* Operation Michael – German forces broke through the reorganized British line at Jussy on the Canal de Saint-Quentin as British forces continue to fall back. Notable in the battle was a British platoon led by Lieutenant Alfred Cecil Herring that retook a captured bridge over Crozat Canal from the Germans and held it for 12 hours before being overwhelmed. Herring was awarded the Victoria Cross after the war.
* Maj. Alfred Cecil Herring, English recipient of the Victoria Cross (b. 1888)
